bill.title: Commuter Benefits; Counties
bill.description: Authorizes the counties to adopt an ordinance requiring employers to offer employees specified commuter benefits options. (HB1010 CD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Passed First Reading
Referred to TRN, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
Bill scheduled to be heard by TRN on Monday, 02-09-15 10:00AM in House conference room 309.

The committees on TRN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Aquino, LoPresti, Ichiyama, Johanson, Keohokalole, Nakashima, San Buenaventura, Takayama, Yamashita, Tupola; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Har, Takumi.
Reported from TRN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 147), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.
Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) C. Lee excused (1).
Re-referred to TRN, FIN, referral sheet 19
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Wednesday, 02-25-15 2:00PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 15 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Nishimoto, Cachola, Cullen, DeCoite, Johanson, Jordan, Keohokalole, Kobayashi, Lowen, Onishi, Tokioka, Yamashita, Pouha; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Ward; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 821) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Third Reading.
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-10-15.
Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 1 with Representative(s) Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott voting no (1) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 260).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM/TRA/JDL, WAM.
The committee(s) on PSM/TRA/JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 03-23-15 9:30AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, Espero, Gabbard, L. Thielen; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Ihara.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in PSM were as follows: 2 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Keith-Agaran; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Baker, Galuteria.
The committee(s) on TRA deferred the measure until 03-24-15 2:55PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on TRA recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in TRA were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Harimoto, Dela Cruz, Inouye, Kidani; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 4 Excused: Senator(s) English, Espero, Kouchi, Slom.
Reported from PSM/TRA/JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1108) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 04-02-15 9:00AM in conference room 211.
The committee(s) on WAM deferred the measure until 04-06-15 9:00AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 9 Aye(s): Senator(s) Tokuda, Kouchi, Chun Oakland, English, Galuteria, Harimoto, Inouye, Riviere, Ruderman; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Dela Cruz.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1444) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-14-15.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Ihara, Inouye . Noes, 2 (Senator(s) Riviere, Slom). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 594) in amended form (SD 2).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 616).
Re-referred to TRN, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 53
House Conferees Appointed: Aquino, Rhoads, Cullen Co-Chairs; Har, LoPresti, Tupola.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 617).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Espero Chair; Nishihara, Keith-Agaran, Harimoto Co-Chairs; Ruderman.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 641).
Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Monday, 04-27-15 10:00AM in conference room 225.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Thursday 04-30-15 10:30AM in conference room 225.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday 05-01-15 11:45AM in conference room 225.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday, 05-01-15 at 1:15 PM in Conference Room 225.

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 5 Ayes: Representative(s) Aquino, Rhoads, Cullen, LoPresti, Tupola; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Har.

The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Nishihara, Keith-Agaran, Harimoto, Ruderman; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 70) as amended in (CD 1).
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday 05-05-15.
Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 70).
48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 05-05-15.
Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). 23 Aye(s); Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Ihara, Inouye . 2 No(es): Senator(s) Riviere, Slom. 0 Excused: none.
Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Kong, McDermott, Thielen, Tupola, Ward voting no (5) and none excused (0).
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 699).
Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 680).
Transmitted to Governor.
